trans-unit.source: Azure AD Connect: Automatic upgrade | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Azure AD Connect: Automatic upgrade | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: This topic describes the built-in automatic upgrade feature in Azure AD Connect sync.
trans-unit.target: This topic describes the built-in automatic upgrade feature in Azure AD Connect sync.

trans-unit.source: Azure AD Connect: Automatic upgrade
trans-unit.target: Azure AD Connect: Automatic upgrade

trans-unit.source: This feature was introduced with build 1.1.105.0 (released February 2016).
trans-unit.target: This feature was introduced with build 1.1.105.0 (released February 2016).

trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.source: Making sure your Azure AD Connect installation is always up to date has never been easier with the **automatic upgrade** feature.
trans-unit.target: Making sure your Azure AD Connect installation is always up to date has never been easier with the **automatic upgrade** feature.

trans-unit.source: This feature is enabled by default for express installations and will make sure that when a new version is released, your installation is automatically upgraded.
trans-unit.target: This feature is enabled by default for express installations and will make sure that when a new version is released, your installation is automatically upgraded.

trans-unit.source: Automatic upgrade is enabled by default for the following:
trans-unit.target: Automatic upgrade is enabled by default for the following:

trans-unit.source: Express settings installation
trans-unit.target: Express settings installation

trans-unit.source: Using SQL Express LocalDB , which is what Express settings will always use
trans-unit.target: Using SQL Express LocalDB , which is what Express settings will always use

trans-unit.source: The AD account is the default MSOL_ account created by Express settings
trans-unit.target: The AD account is the default MSOL_ account created by Express settings

trans-unit.source: Have less than 100,000 objects in the metaverse
trans-unit.target: Have less than 100,000 objects in the metaverse

trans-unit.source: The current state of automatic upgrade can be viewed with the PowerShell cmdlet `Get-ADSyncAutoUpgrade`.
trans-unit.target: The current state of automatic upgrade can be viewed with the PowerShell cmdlet `Get-ADSyncAutoUpgrade`.

trans-unit.source: It has the following states:
trans-unit.target: It has the following states:

trans-unit.source: State
trans-unit.target: State

trans-unit.source: Comment
trans-unit.target: Comment

trans-unit.source: Enabled
trans-unit.target: Enabled

trans-unit.source: Automatic upgrade is enabled.
trans-unit.target: Automatic upgrade is enabled.

trans-unit.source: Suspended
trans-unit.target: Suspended

trans-unit.source: Set by the system only.
trans-unit.target: Set by the system only.

trans-unit.source: The system is no longer eligible to receive automatic upgrades.
trans-unit.target: The system is no longer eligible to receive automatic upgrades.

trans-unit.source: Disabled
trans-unit.target: Disabled

trans-unit.source: Automatic upgrade is disabled.
trans-unit.target: Automatic upgrade is disabled.

trans-unit.source: You can change between **Enabled** and **Disabled** with `Set-ADSyncAutoUpgrade`.
trans-unit.target: You can change between **Enabled** and **Disabled** with `Set-ADSyncAutoUpgrade`.

trans-unit.source: Only the system should set the state **Suspended**.
trans-unit.target: Only the system should set the state **Suspended**.

trans-unit.source: Automatic upgrade is using Azure AD Connect Health as the upgrade infrastructure.
trans-unit.target: Automatic upgrade is using Azure AD Connect Health as the upgrade infrastructure.

trans-unit.source: For automatic upgrade to correctly work, make sure you have opened the URLs in the proxy for **Azure AD Connect Health** as documented in [Office 365 URLs and IP address ranges ](https://support.office.com/article/Office-365-URLs-and-IP-address-ranges-8548a211-3fe7-47cb-abb1-355ea5aa88a2).
trans-unit.target: For automatic upgrade to correctly work, make sure you have opened the URLs in the proxy for **Azure AD Connect Health** as documented in [Office 365 URLs and IP address ranges ](https://support.office.com/article/Office-365-URLs-and-IP-address-ranges-8548a211-3fe7-47cb-abb1-355ea5aa88a2).

trans-unit.source: If the **Synchronization Service Manager** UI is running on the server, then the upgrade will be suspended until the UI is closed.
trans-unit.target: If the **Synchronization Service Manager** UI is running on the server, then the upgrade will be suspended until the UI is closed.

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: Learn more about [Integrating your on-premises identities with Azure Active Directory](active-directory-aadconnect.md).
trans-unit.target: Learn more about [Integrating your on-premises identities with Azure Active Directory](active-directory-aadconnect.md).
